1 import time
2 from dataclasses import dataclass
3 from threading import Thread, Event
4 from typing import Callable
5 
6 import cv2
7 import numpy as np
8 
9 import rospy
10 from .abstract_stream import AbstractStream
11 
12 
13 @dataclass
14 class CameraConfig:
15  acquisition_rate: int
16  mtx: np.ndarray
17  dist: np.ndarray
18  width_img: float
19  height_img: float
20  flip: bool = False
21 
22  def to_ros_camera_info(self):
23  """Converts the camera configuration to a ROS message."""
24  from sensor_msgs.msg import CameraInfo
25  msg = CameraInfo()
26  msg.width = int(self.width_img)
27  msg.height = int(self.height_img)
28  msg.K = self.mtx.flatten().tolist()
29  msg.D = self.dist.flatten().tolist()
30  return msg
31 
32 
33 class Rate:
34 
35  def __init__(self, hz: int):
36  self.__interval = 1.0 / hz
37  self.__last_time = time.time()
38 
39  def sleep(self):
40  now = time.time()
41  elapsed = now - self.__last_time
42  if elapsed < self.__interval:
43  time.sleep(self.__interval - elapsed)
44  self.__last_time = now
45 
46 
47 class Stream(AbstractStream):
48 
49  def __init__(self, camera_index: int, config: CameraConfig, publish_frame_cb: Callable[[np.ndarray], None]):
50  """
51  Initializes the camera stream.
52  :param camera_index: Index of the camera to use (0 for the first camera, 1 for the second, etc.)
53  :param config: Camera configuration
54  :param publish_frame_cb: Callback function to publish the frame
55  """
56  super().__init__(publish_frame_cb)
57  self.__camera_index = camera_index
58  self.__config = config
59 
60  self._frame = np.zeros((int(config.height_img), int(config.width_img), 3), dtype=np.uint8)
61  self.__acquisition_thread = None
62  self.__stop_acquisition = Event()
63  self.__rate = Rate(config.acquisition_rate)
64 
65  def __del__(self):
66  try:
67  self.stop()
68  except RuntimeError:
69  pass
70 
71  @property
72  def is_available(self) -> bool:
73  """Checks if the camera is available."""
74  if self.is_active:
75  return True
76 
77  tmp_video_stream = cv2.VideoCapture(self.__camera_index)
78  is_opened = tmp_video_stream.isOpened()
79  tmp_video_stream.release()
80  return is_opened
81 
82  def start(self):
83  """Starts the video stream."""
84 
85  if self.__acquisition_thread is not None:
86  raise RuntimeError("Video stream is already started")
87 
88  self.__stop_acquisition.clear()
89  self.__acquisition_thread = Thread(target=self.__loop, daemon=True)
90  self.__acquisition_thread.start()
91 
92  def stop(self):
93  if self.__acquisition_thread is None:
94  raise RuntimeError("Video stream is already stopped")
95 
96  self.__stop_acquisition.set()
97  self.__acquisition_thread.join()
98  self.__acquisition_thread = None
99  self.__stop_acquisition.clear()
100 
101  def __process_frame(self, frame: np.ndarray):
102  """Processes the frame (e.g., flips it)."""
103  if self.__config.flip:
104  cv2.flip(frame, -1, dst=frame)
105 
106  cv2.undistort(src=frame, cameraMatrix=self.__config.mtx, distCoeffs=self.__config.dist, dst=self._frame)
107  self._post_process()
108 
109  def __loop(self):
110  video_stream = cv2.VideoCapture(self.__camera_index)
111  if not video_stream.isOpened():
112  raise RuntimeError("Can't connect to the camera")
113 
114  # This loop ensure the stream always restart after an error
115  while not self.__stop_acquisition.is_set():
116 
117  # Main acquisition loop
118  while video_stream.isOpened():
119  if self.__stop_acquisition.is_set():
120  video_stream.release()
121  break
122 
123  ret, frame = video_stream.read()
124  if not ret:
125  rospy.logwarn('Failed to read frame from camera')
126  break
127 
128  self.__process_frame(frame)
129  try:
130  self._publish_frame(self._frame)
131  except Exception as e:
132  rospy.logerr(f'Failed to publish frame: {e}')
133  self.__rate.sleep()
134 
135  # If we end up here, it means either the camera is not available anymore or we failed to get a frame
136  while not video_stream.isOpened() or video_stream.grab() is False:
137  if self.__stop_acquisition.is_set():
138  video_stream.release()
139  break
140 
141  time.sleep(1)
142  video_stream.open(self.__camera_index)
143 
144  @property
145  def is_active(self) -> bool:
146  return self.__acquisition_thread is not None and not self.__stop_acquisition.is_set()
